readme:
# Emojiblast

Emojiblast turns Atom into a full-featured [Emojicode](http://www.emojicode.org)
IDE.

- Build and run Emojicode programs within Atom
- Emojicode grammar
- Snippets for classes, methods, protocols, etc.

## Dependencies

- You of course must have Emojicode installed on
your system. If you haven't yet visit: http://www.emojicode.org/docs/guides/#installing
- 
[Atom Linter](https://github.com/atom-community/linter).

## Setting up a project

Every project needs a JSON file called `blast.json` in the root directory. The
file can include the following options:

- `projectName` (required): The name of the project. The output file when
you compile your project will be named like this.
- `files` (required): List all files that need to be compiled into the binary in this array.
Non-absolute paths are relative to the project root.
- `runDirectory`: The current working directory when running your projects.
  Defaults to the project root.
- `compilerPath`: The path to the compiler.
- `enginePath`: The path to the engine.

Example:

```
{
  "projectName": "GrandProject",
  "files": ["quiz.emojic"]
}
```
